result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase E. Sandmire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

120 days conditional jail time on count 1, with start date at the discretion of the agent (agent should not require him to serve it til November); work release privileges on the jail time.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No possess/consumption of alcohol.  Submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine to monitor compliance.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management.  Take any other treatment and/or assessments ordered by the agent.

No contact with Richland Center High School.

No gun or bow hunting.  No trapping.  No fishing.  No applying for DNR license.  No accompanying people doing those activities.  Other Chapter 29 privileges, other than those stated here, are allowed.

Expungement to be allowed per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.  

Defendant to pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Defendant to submit to DNA sampling at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

DA has requested restitution of $942.36 to RCHS.  The Defense has asked for an opportunity to review this request.  At the time of sentencing, the Court held open the matter of restitution and gave the State 15 days to disclose restitution information.  The Court further gave the Defense 15 days to respond.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With work release.  Start date at agent's discretion but not before November 2015.

records.addlTxt: Probation extended 1 year or until successful completion of Anger Management. (copy forwarded to P/P and DA)

01:47 PM Defendant Chase E. Sandmire not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Hearing set at Court's request. DOC has stated def is nearing end of sentence and either needs extended to complete anger mgt or have the a.m. requirement removed. State objects to removal of the condition. Court orders 1 year extension; wants P/P to provide the order for Court's signature.
from Probation and Parole Agent re def's status

records.addlTxt: RCSD Disposition of Warrant or Commitment - Time Served
Restitution having been paid by co-defendant in 15CF27, restitution for this case is now set at $0.

Several cases called together:  15CF26/adjourned initial, 15CF29/adjourned initial, 15CM59/status, and status in 15TR447-449.  Defendant Chase E. Sandmire in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of all matters; states the agreement for the record.

Prelims waived in 15CF26 and 15CF29.  Informations filed in both cases.  Court's colloquy on prelim waivers on both cases.  Def pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2 of 15CF26 and count 1 of 15CF29, those three charges being the only charges carried over in the information from the original complaints.  DA has asked for DPA of 4 years in 15CF29 and probation with restitution and other conditions in 15CF26; other cases to be dismissed or dismissed/read in.  Court finds defendant guilty in all pleaded to counts.  Sentence ordered withheld in 15CF29 for the 4 yr DPA.

DA address Court on proposed sentence in 15CF26:  Count 1 - 120 day jail sentence.  For both counts, DA asks for probation to include absolute sobriety, anger management, and all assts and treatment as recommended by agent.  Also, no contact with RCHS.  Additionally, both as probation condition and condition of DPA, def not to gun or bow hunt in any shape or form including animal or bird, no trapping of any kind, no fishing of any kind, no applying for a license for any of those activities under Chapter 29, and no accompanying anyone participating in those activities.  Other Chapter 29 privileges, those not already stated, are allowed.  If the Defendant is able to successfully complete probation, counsel are asking for expungement as def has no prior criminal record.  Atty. Lawrence addresses the Court.

Court rules on sentence:

15CF26
Def placed on 4 years probation with conditions - 120 days on count 1, with start date at the discretion of the agent (agent should not require him to serve it til November); work release privileges on the jail; maintain absolute sobriety; no possess/consumption of alcohol; evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine to monitor; anger management; take any other treatment/assts ordered by agent; no contact with RCHS; no gun or bow hunting; no trapping; no fishing; no applying for DNR license; no accompanying people doing those activities.  Expungement to be allowed per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.  Costs.

DA has requested restitution of $942.36 to RCHS.  Atty. Lawrence asks for opportunity to review that request.  Court gives DA 15 days to disclose and defense 15 days to respond.

15CF29
Diversion agreement approved and ordered for 4 years.  Court amends bond to signature and orders cash bond released to the poster.

Felony firearm and other felony admonishments provided.  DNA sampling ordered at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

Parties are working toward resolution. Reset for August.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Chase E. Sandmire in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Lawrence gives status of matters, requests further scheduling to reach resolution.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 09:00 am. Court notes scanned complaint states case number is 14CF26 but should be 15CF26 as case was filed in 2015.

3 cases called together (15CF26,15CF29 & 15CM59) Defendant Chase E. Sandmire in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence (special appearance). Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received the complaints in this matter, waives formal reading. Court informs def of charges/max possible penalties. Defense wishes to waive time limits for prelim. Court accepts waiver of time limits for prelim.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
